subject: Broken connecter
description_text:
Hi Simsonn Support Team,

I hope you’re doing well. I recently purchased a set of *Simsonn Plus X
pedals*, and unfortunately, the *RJ11 connector for the load cell* broke
off during setup. As a result, the load cell has become disconnected, and
the brake pedal is no longer connecting.

The rest of the unit appears to be in perfect condition — it’s just the
RJ11 connection that was damaged. I wanted to reach out before attempting
any further repair to see if a *replacement load cell or load cell cable
assembly* could be sent out under warranty or purchased as a replacement
part.

Here are my details:

   -

   *Product:* Simsonn Plus X Pedals
   -

   *Purchase Date:* October 4th
   -

   *Purchased From: Amazon *
   -

   *Order Number:* 114-3645172-7744262

I can also provide photos of the damage if needed. Please let me know the
best way to proceed — I’d really appreciate any help you can provide so I
can get the pedals back up and running.

Thank you very much for your time and support.

Best regards,
*Chase Matsko*
? chasematsko@gmail.com

conversations.body_text: Hi Chase Matsko,  Please send me a photo so I can check where the wire is broken. If the break is close to the RJ11 connector, you can visit a nearby computer repair shop and have them re-crimp a new RJ11 connector, following the same wiring order as the clutch. If it can’t be repaired, please contact us and we’ll send you a new brake sensor for replacement.

I just got it fixed thank you!!!

On Thu, Oct 9, 2025 at 9:15 PM support@simsonn.com
